name: mandatorily
content:

in a way that must be done, or is demanded by law: All countries of the world should have to mandatorily report on the representation of women in parliamentary bodies. Planes are mandatorily wide enough to allow the removal of the safety seat.
More examplesFewer examplesBasic annual leave is mandatorily given to employees, according to the labour legislation.The reform mandatorily applying the law to members of Parliament was defeated.They mandatorily detain asylum seekers while their claims are being processed.
